issue.title: Symlink routes aren't working
issue.body:
A new bug was introduced in `1.0.0-next.432` of SvelteKit 

See SvelteKit [Issue #6303](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/6303)

### Reproduction

**1.0.0-next.432** (broke)
‚ùå https://github.com/oneezy/sveltekit-symlink-repro-next-432

**1.0.0-next.431** (working)
‚úÖ https://github.com/oneezy/sveltekit-symlink-repro-next-431

---

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7369575/186837092-952bfe1b-e8d9-47bf-9298-bd037cb041f0.png)

issue.title: Implement new layouts system
issue.body:
# How to migration from named layouts

Named layouts have been removed in favor of `(groups)`. See the documentation for an introduction: https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/advanced-routing#advanced-layouts

How to migrate highly depends on your use case:

### Use case 1: Rewinding to an earlier layout / "breaking out"

If you used named layouts to rewind the layout inheritance chain to a layout higher up the tree, you can reference the segment directly now:

```diff
src/routes/
‚îú marketing/
‚îÇ ‚îú pricing/
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú business/
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî +layout@marketing.svelte // reference the "marketing" segment (i.e. the folder with the name) in your routes
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî +layout.svelte
- ‚îú +layout-marketing.svelte
- ‚îú +layout@marketing.svelte
+ ‚îî +layout.svelte
```

### Use case 2: Rewinding to a blank root layout

If you had `+layout-blank.svelte` in your root to reset to a blank layout, you need to adjust your actual root layout to be blank and move that functionality into another layout further below in the tree, either using an if-statement in your root layout or using the `(group)` feature:

```diff
src/routes/
+ (main)
+ ‚îú marketing/
+ ‚îÇ ‚îú pricing/
+ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî +layout@.svelte
+ ‚îî +layout.svelte // this is now what used to be src/routes/+layout.svelte
- marketing/
- ‚îú pricing/
- ‚îÇ ‚îî +layout@blank.svelte
- +layout-blank.svelte
‚îî +layout.svelte // this is now what used to be src/routes/+layout-blank.svelte
```

### Use case 3: Different layouts for routes at the same nesting level

If you used named layouts to specify "these 2 pages get layout X and these other 2 next to them get layout Y", use groups instead.

Before:
```
src/routes/
‚îú about/
‚îÇ ‚îî +page@unauthed.svelte
‚îú admin/
‚îÇ ‚îî +page@authed.svelte
‚îú home
‚îÇ ‚îî +page@unauthed.svelte
‚îú user/
‚îÇ ‚îî +page@authed.svelte
‚îú +layout-authed.svelte
‚îî +layout-unauthed.svelte
```
After
```
src/routes/
‚îú (authed)
‚îÇ ‚îú admin/
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî +page.svelte
‚îÇ ‚îú user/
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî +page.svelte
‚îÇ ‚îî +layout.svelte
‚îú (unauthed)
‚îÇ ‚îú about/
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî +page.svelte
‚îÇ ‚îú home
‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî +page.svelte
‚îÇ ‚îî +layout.svelte
```

### Use case 4: arbitrary inheritance chains

If you previously used named layouts to enhance other named layouts, which also enhance layouts, to mix and match them, then that's no longer possible this way. In cases like this - which from reading the layout chains probably got confusing anyway - we advice to use composition and/or if-statements instead. The new documentation has a section with an example for this as inspiration.

# PR description

#6124 

Closes #6196 (using `(groups)` and/or composition)
Closes #5763 (root layout guaranteed to always exist + `await parent()`)
Closes #5311 (`+page@.svelte`)
Closes #4940 (no longer possible to get into this situation)
Closes #2154 (only a single root layout now)


* [x] documentation
* [x] prevent conflicts
* [x] print useful error when encountering a `+layout-foo.svelte`
* [x] simplify the code that currently has to deal with named layouts
* [x] update `write_types`
* [x] don't reference root layout/error in `dictionary` in `client-manifest.js`
* [x] get it to work in windows

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [x] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. All changesets should be `patch` until SvelteKit 1.0

body:
I believe the issue is somewhere around here:
[kit/src/core/sync/create_manifest_data/index.js](
https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/master/packages/kit/src/core/sync/create_manifest_data/index.js#L159-L161)

Doing a little research I found the symlink issue was fixed by @mikenikles in PR [#4957](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/4957) and recently broke with PR [#6174](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/6174)

### The Fix [(commit eb2ab91)](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/commit/eb2ab91338e10d081191f493e3e75abd6ad760d2?diff=split)
> As per @Conduitry's comment, this would error on symlinks to files, as `readdirSync` throws when not called on a directory.
>
> There seems to be a problem with Node's `fs.readdirSync(dir, { withFileTypes: true })` returning `false` for `isDirectory()` on symlinks (open issue at https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/30646). It doesn't seem likely to get fixed upstream in a timely manner, so reverting to `fs.statSync` instead of `withFileTypes` seems like a better solution.
>
_Originally posted by @mrkishi in https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/4957#pullrequestreview-974512804_

---
With the recent rewrite from @Rich-Harris  I believe this was accidentally written back to the old `withFileTypes: true` way in [create_manifest_data/index.js (lines 159-161)](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/master/packages/kit/src/core/sync/create_manifest_data/index.js#L159-L161)
```javascript
// kit/src/core/sync/create_manifest_data/index.js (lines 159-161)

const files = fs.readdirSync(dir, {
    withFileTypes: true
});
```

rename.to: üêõ Symlink routes no longer work (since 1.0.0-next.432 ‚Äî PR #6174)

PR #6174 refactored quite a bit of the code from it's previous state.

issue.title: [fix] symlink routes
issue.body:
Fixes #6303

No test because I don't know how to write one for this. @oneezy could you test out if this fixes the issue for you?

- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
